revised_title: Retarded Potentials and the Expansion of the Universe: A Study in Boundary Conditions
tldr: This article explores the relationship between Maxwell's equations in a cosmological space-time and Kirchhoff's formula. It examines the boundary conditions imposed by the expansion of the universe and investigates whether the phase relations between sources can eliminate the divergence. The study focuses on the Einstein-de Sitter and steady-state models, considering their implications for the behavior of retarded and advanced potentials.
